intro: Protium carolense, commonly known as Carolinian wild pepper, is a small evergreen tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces orange-red drupes that are edible, though they are not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
